# Data Access {.unnumbered}

To access your Snowflake account follow the instructions here: *Coming Soon*

Once you have access to your Snowflake account, to set up your Snowflake Notebook, follow the following steps:

1. In the Home page, where you land when you log in, select **+ Create** > **Notebook** > **New Notebook** 

::: {style="text-align: center;"}
<img src="img/snow/create_notebook.png" width="400"/>

:::


2. In the pop up window, select the following options, then hit **Create** 

::: {style="text-align: center;"}
<img src="img/snow/notebook_options.png" width="400"/>

:::


3. In the **Databases** tab, you'll find all the datasets available to you inside the `PAKISTAN_FLOODS_2022_DATA` database. Note the Schemas align to the dataset categories shared on the Data page

::: {style="text-align: center;"}
<img src="img/snow/databases.png" width="400"/>

:::


4. Navigate to the top right **Packages** dropdown to install your favourite Python packages from the [Snowflake Conda Channel](https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/snowflake/) for you to use

::: {style="text-align: center;"}
<img src="img/snow/anaconda_packages.png" width="400"/>

:::


5. Your Snowflake Notebook is ready to go! Create Markdown, SQL or Python cells to support you on your mission!
